info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 14 at 4:54AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of Silver Bow County through 545 AM MDT... At 452 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a band of intense snow along a line extending from 25 miles east of East Helena to 13 miles southeast of Gibbonsville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-quarter mile or less and winds in excess of 30 to 40 mph are anticipated. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Butte, Silver Bow, Walkerville, Divide, Nissler, Melrose, Janney and Newcomb. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 217 and 231. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
